title: Kia EV3 wins 2025 World Car of the Year award
description: The Kia EV3 has bagged the 2025 World Car of the Year (WCOTY) award, which was announced at the New York International Auto Show on April 16, 2025. The other two finalists in the race were the BMW X3 and the Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric. After the Kia Telluride (2020 WCOTY winner) and EV9 (2024 WCOTY winner), the EV3 is the third vehicle from the South Korean manufacturer to receive the top honour.  Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric won the EV of the year title Volvo EX90 got the 2025 luxury car award Vehicles eligible for the WCOTY award had to be produced in volumes of at least 10,000 units per year, priced below the luxury-car level in their primary markets and be on sale in at least two major car markets (China, Europe, India, Japan, Korea, Latin America and the US) on at least two separate continents within the period January 1, 2024, and March 30, 2025. World Car Awards also announced winners in six other categories: 2025 World Urban Car of the Year BYD Seagull Other contenders: Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric, Mini Cooper Electric 2025 World Luxury Car of the Year  Volvo EX90 Other contenders: Porsche Macan, Porsche Panamera 2025 World Performance Car of the Year Porsche 911 Carrera GTS Other contenders: BMW M5, Porsche Taycan Turbo GT 2025 World Electric Vehicle of the Year  Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric Other contenders: Kia EV3, Porsche Macan Electric 2025 World Car Design of the Year  Volkswagen ID. Buzz Other contenders: Kia EV3, Toyota Land Cruiser / Land Cruiser 250 2025 World Car Person of the Year Stella Li, executive VP, BYD Other contenders: Ralph Gilles (Stellantis), Simon Humphries (Toyota) 2025 World Car Awards jury For 2025, the World Car Awards jury consisted of 96 distinguished automotive journalists from 30 countries. Among them were Hormazd Sorabjee, editor of Autocar India, and Renuka Kirpalani, consulting editor (video) at Autocar India. html:
The Porsche 911 Carrera GTS was awarded the 2025 World Performance Car of the Year award.

The Kia EV3 has bagged the 2025 World Car of the Year (WCOTY) award, which was announced at the New York International Auto Show on April 16, 2025. The other two finalists in the race were the BMW X3 and the Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric. After the Kia Telluride (2020 WCOTY winner) and EV9 (2024 WCOTY winner), the EV3 is the third vehicle from the South Korean manufacturer to receive the top honour. 

  1. Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric won the EV of the year title
  2. Volvo EX90 got the 2025 luxury car award

Vehicles eligible for the WCOTY award had to be produced in volumes of at least 10,000 units per year, priced below the luxury-car level in their primary markets and be on sale in at least two major car markets (China, Europe, India, Japan, Korea, Latin America and the US) on at least two separate continents within the period January 1, 2024, and March 30, 2025. World Car Awards also announced winners in six other categories:

2025 World Urban Car of the Year

BYD Seagull

Other contenders: Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric, Mini Cooper Electric

2025 World Luxury Car of the Year 

Volvo EX90

Other contenders: Porsche Macan, Porsche Panamera

2025 World Performance Car of the Year

Porsche 911 Carrera GTS

Other contenders: BMW M5, Porsche Taycan Turbo GT

2025 World Electric Vehicle of the Year 

Hyundai Inster / Casper Electric

Other contenders: Kia EV3, Porsche Macan Electric

2025 World Car Design of the Year 

Volkswagen ID. Buzz

Other contenders: Kia EV3, Toyota Land Cruiser / Land Cruiser 250

2025 World Car Person of the Year

Stella Li, executive VP, BYD

Other contenders: Ralph Gilles (Stellantis), Simon Humphries (Toyota)

2025 World Car Awards jury

For 2025, the World Car Awards jury consisted of 96 distinguished automotive journalists from 30 countries. Among them were Hormazd Sorabjee, editor of Autocar India, and Renuka Kirpalani, consulting editor (video) at Autocar India.
